name: Persian Mythology
meanings:
Faravahar
The Winged Disk, Symbol of Divine Glory
The most recognizable symbol of Zoroastrianism, depicting a winged figure representing the human soul and divine glory (khvarenah).

extracted_title: Ancient Wisdom Meets Modern Physics - Kabbalah Integration
extracted_headings: 72/144: Names of God & Euler Characteristic ‚Üí Three Generations
10: Sefirot & SO(10) Grand Unification ‚Äî 45 Generators & 22 Paths
288: Sparks of Creation ‚Äî Topological Multiplicity Across Four Worlds
Pneuma & Divine Breath ‚Äî Matter as Condensate
64: Pneuma Components, DNA Codons & I Ching Hexagrams
Qlippoth (Shells/Husks) & Shadow Branes ‚Äî The Dark Side
The Deeper Pattern: Structure Mirrors Structure
Dimensional Cascade: From Infinite to Finite
extracted_lists: NOT established physics - String theory, M-theory, and dimensional physics remain experimentally unverified speculations
HIGH risk of apophenia - Finding patterns in random data is a well-documented cognitive bias
Alternative explanations exist - Coincidence, confirmation bias, numerological fallacies, and cultural projection are equally valid interpretations
Numerology bias: The natural world contains countless numbers‚Äîfinding matches between Kabbalah and physics is statistically probable by chance alone
Retrofitting modern concepts: Projecting contemporary physics terminology (dimensions, branes, Euler characteristics) onto ancient mystical texts is methodologically questionable
Confirmation bias: This analysis highlights numeric correlations while ignoring non-matching elements, incomplete correspondences, and contradictory data
Cultural projection: Reading our scientific worldview into texts created for entirely different purposes (spiritual development, mystical contemplation)
Unfalsifiability: Most proposed correlations cannot be experimentally tested or empirically disproven
Selection effects: Kabbalah contains hundreds of numbers, concepts, and structures‚Äîsome matches with physics are inevitable in such a rich symbolic system
Misunderstanding both domains: Risk of oversimplifying both Kabbalistic depth and physics complexity to force artificial correlations
13: The 13D shadow theory in physics parallels the 13 attributes of divine mercy in Kabbalah (Exodus 34:6-7) and the 13 petaled rose symbolism in mystical Judaism.

7: The 7-dimensional G‚ÇÇ manifold in compactification theory mirrors the seven lower Sefirot (Chesed through Malkhut), the seven days of creation, and the seven-fold structure of reality in Jewish mysticism.

248: The Torah contains 248 positive commandments, corresponding to the traditional count of bones/organs in the human body. In physics, E‚Çà‚Äîone of the exceptional Lie groups studied in string theory‚Äîhas dimension 248.

137: The fine structure constant Œ± ‚âà 1/137 governs electromagnetic interaction strength. In Jewish mysticism, 137 is the gematria of ◊ß÷∑◊ë÷∏÷º◊ú÷∏◊î (Kabbalah) itself. Some medieval Kabbalists associated 137 with the phrase "to receive" or "tradition."

meaning: Fire as the supreme symbol of divine wisdom, purity, and truth. Sacred fires burn continuously in Zoroastrian temples.
description:
